content.text: What Is Profit and Loss Statement?
The P&L statement shows revenue, expenses, and profit over a time period. It tells whether the company is making money from operations.
Revenue, Operating Profit, Interest, Tax, Net Profit.
Rising revenue with stable margins indicates business strength. Falling margins may signal cost pressure or competition.
If revenue is ₹1000 and expenses are ₹800, profit is ₹200. Profit margin = 20%.
